page.title: 07Family Life
page.content: The children are up with their father and see him off to work, I am usually up and about by 8 o'clock, checking that they have had their breakfast and that my son has had a wash, contact with soap and water is not high on his list of priorities at the moment. By 8.15am. they have left for school. I switch on the washing machine, prepare my breakfast and try and watch the 8.30am. news on Breakfast Television. I then shower and change and make sure the beds are made, venturing with great trepidation into my daughters room, her promise to 'keep it tidy' hasn't been kept, nine times out of ten it resembles a church jumble sale, with piles of clothes everywhere. I make a mental note to remind her of her promise, yet again!
